ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned Italian to the point where I can claim that I have elementary proficiency.
More Italian vocabulary, grammar, speaking skills, and reading skills.

Through this course, I was able to further develop my Italian speaking and writing skills. We built on basic grammar rules from ITAL 110 and were able to write coherent paragraphs by the end of the course.
Italian speaking, reading, and culture
Italian basics and grammar
Level two Italian
I improved my writing and reading skills in Italian.
I learned to speak, read, and write Italian!

Complex Italian grammar such as the subjunctive tense. We also practiced a lot of reading, writing, listening, and speaking. For our particular section there was an emphasis on Italian films and culture because our professor is an expert in the field.
I deepened my knowledge of Italian language and learnt Italian culture

This course serves as an excellent continuation of L1 fall Italian. Comparatively, you can expect to focus on more advanced reading comprehension and speaking conversationally while the rigorous grammar and vocabulary learning continues. The course helps you digest harder texts in Italian and really pushes you towards a more fluent level in the language. Furthermore, as an Italian native, my instructor gave interesting cultural insights throughout the course and invited us to many department events where we could learn so much more about the country and opportunities surrounding it.
Continued learning italian in an engaging way

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course is well planned, and the instructor is always accessible.

Strengths: lots of engagement throughout the class that was helpful for tests and practiced a lot of speaking 
Weaknesses: expected us to learn the grammar topics on our own which ended up being a bit tough. Wish we slowed down and walked through parts in English at times.

Strengths: very engaging in the sense that we do speak Italian in class and therefore are immersed into the language during class. The intensity of the course also allows for students to actually learn the language, rather than simply getting by.
I think the course was pretty structured and liked how the professor provided a lot of support in many different aspects when needed.
Could be more engaging
Lots of opportunities to engage in informal discussions, give class presentations, read interesting stories, keep up with Italian news, and watch classical films in Italian.
Strengths are that the course layout is very organized. A weakness would be that the difficulty of the reading comprehension portion of the final was significantly higher than that of previous exams
The weaknesses are the workload is a lot with tests every other weekend. Strengths are that you learn Italian quick.

A lot of interaction with Italy through reading news articles and watching movies. The feedback was also clear and I was able to ask questions whenever I had them. Some potential weaknesses are that it's a lot of content in a short amount of time.
Strength - asynchronous days

The strength of this course is that it's really what you make of it and malleable for teachers in a good sense. The syllabus is well structured and tries very hard to find a balance of learning all skills in the language. The small department is really such a close community- they're so open and friendly. You can go to many events to support your Italian learning experience and they make everyone welcome. From having multiple instructors across my sequence, I can say that the grading is holistically very lenient but you still are pushed to succeed in the language. Moreover, I like the oral exam and freedom of asynchronous activities (as well as the asynchronous day generally). Weaknesses: the in-class exams can seem overbearing at times. They are definitely an important commitment mechanism and progress tracker, however, combined with the compositions, it can seem hard to focus on studying. The textbook also is expensive; however, this is uniform for most languages and it serves you for a full sequence (L1+2).
I think more emphasis on speaking in class for practice

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend the course to someone who already has some introductory knowledge of Italian.

Yes because it built on Italian 110 well and was a cool language to learn. This course dove into Italian culture more which was interesting but did not help you through learning grammar skills in class it was all on your own.

I would recommend this class to other students if they were interested in learning Italian and were actually serious about it. While it is not the easiest course offered at Yale, or even amongst the different language departments, I feel the intensity of the course and the exam schedule is what helps you learn. It holds you accountable and since all the material is building on top of each other, what you learned previously is constantly being practiced.
yes if they are interested in italian
Yes! Best language taught at Yale
Yes, if a student is interested in learning italian.
Yes but you must be willing to study a lot.
If you are willing to put in the work and you want to learn Italian definitely!! The professor was also great and very funny.
Its harder than L1 but useful if you want to progress in Italian

I truly believe the Italian department is one of the best at Yale. No matter your instructor, if you're interested in Italian, you'll gain significant ability in the language. As someone who knows many languages, the change in my personal level of Italian Ive achieved through this course has been second to none!
Yes.
